details.purpose: To record blood group and antibody findings.

description.other_details:
NEHTA, Australia. Pathology Episode v1.0 - Data Group library [Internet]. 2009;[cited 2009 Dec 8 ] Available from: http://www.nehta.gov.au/data-group-library/data-specifications/dgl-pathology
IHE. IHE, Laboratory Technical Framework, Volume 3 Content [Internet]. 2008;Available from: http://www.ihe.net/Technical_Framework/upload/ihe_lab_TF_rel2_1-Vol-3_FT_2008-08-08.pdf.

items.items: Group of findings relating to one antibody.

To record the result of a laboratory test which may be used to record a single valued test but will often be specialised or templated to represent multiple value or 'panel' tests. This archetype also acts as the parent for specialisations appropriate for more specific laboratory tests microbiology, histopathology.
Blood group information including ABO, Rhesus and antibodies etc.

Specific identifier for this lab test. e.g. Full blood count , blood glucose, urine microbiology. May equate to the result name for a single value result. Commonly a coded term e.g from LOINC or SNOMED-CT.
Representations of the whole test in mutlimedia e.g image, audio, video.
Demographic details of the laboratory with responsibility for the test. Details of secondary laboratories may also be included.
This is an initial or interim result - further updates are anticipated.
This is the final result. No further alterations are anticipated.
This is a supplementary result ehich should be appended to a previous result.
This is a correction which should completely replace any previous results.
An overall interpretative comment on this test.
The local ID assigned to the order by the order requester. Equivalent to the Placer Order Identifier.
The local ID assigned to the test order by the order filler, usually by the (LIS) Laboratory Information System. Equivalent to the DICOM Accession Number and the Filler Order Identifier.
Details of the specimen being reported where all individual results are derived from the same specimen.
The identifier given to the laboratory test result of a pathology investigation.
The status of the lab test as a whole.
The test was aborted and never completed.
The date and/or time that the result was issued for the recorded ‘test status’.
The date and time related to the results status is useful for version control and cumulative results for the report.
The type of high-level diagnostic service e.g. biochemistry, haematology.
Slot to allow an annotation to be added to a particular test result at run-time.
Details of the clinician or organisation requesting the laboratory test.
